TopicTitle: Can you tell me a good ascent path for RealSolarSystem?

Articles.Content:
hi, recently i started playing KSP with realism overhaul mod, i noticed that a rocket needs 9,5-10km/s of delta v to get into orbit so I designed a 11km/s delta v rocket, i launched it but it didn't get into orbit so i deduced that my ascent path was wrong. Can you tell me a good ascent path for real solar system- realism overhaul?

EDIT: i'm using FAR

Edited April 11, 2014 by manuelasa1999
are you using Stock aerodynamics or FAR? If you are using far you should begin your gravity turn almost immediately. Take a look at some actual launches and watch their ascent profile.

are you using Stock aerodynamics or FAR? If you are using far you should begin your gravity turn almost immediately. Take a look at some actual launches and watch their ascent profile.

Im using FAR

https://github.com/NathanKell/RealSolarSystem/wiki/_pages should help!

Thank you it was usefull
